title: USS Charles Phelps (1848)
text:
USS "Charles Phelps" (1848) was a ship acquired by the <a href="Union%20Navy">Union Navy</a> during the <a href="American%20Civil%20War">American Civil War</a>. She was used by the Navy as an auxiliary support vessel, delivering coal to Union steamers blockading Confederate ports.
"Charles Phelps" was built in 1848 at <a href="New%20London%2C%20Connecticut">New London, Connecticut</a>, as a whaler; purchased at <a href="New%20Bedford%2C%20Massachusetts">New Bedford, Massachusetts</a>, 24 June 1861; and commissioned later in the year, Acting Master W. F. North in command.
Supporting the steamships of the North Atlantic Blockade.
Assigned as a coal supply ship for the <a href="North%20Atlantic%20Blockading%20Squadron">North Atlantic Blockading Squadron</a>, Charles Phelps served in <a href="Hampton%20Roads%2C%20Virginia">Hampton Roads, Virginia</a>, throughout the Civil War. 
Her support of the Squadron's steamers was as critical a contribution to their mission of cutting the <a href="Confederate%20States%20of%20America">Confederacy</a> off from overseas supply as a modern-day oiler's logistic support is to the operations of the fleet. 
Post-war decommissioning and sale.
"Charles Phelps" was sold at <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> 25 October 1865.
